However, some resolutions can lead to data loss. As a result, please exercise caution when this risk is highlighted below.

title: Unable to delete content pack via UI

contents.title: Issue/Introduction
contents.text:
Uninstalling Content Pack failed. Request failed 440 (client error 440) error while trying to uninstall content pack from UI.

Error found in ui_runtime.log:

[2024-04-09 11:15:13.525+0000] ["https-openssl-apr-443-exec-7"/xx.xx.xx.xx ERROR] [com.vmware.loginsight.web.actions.misc.ContentPackActionBean] [Uninstalling content pack failed, com.vmware.vro]
com.vmware.loginsight.api.ApiException: Request failed. 440: Client Error (440)
 at com.vmware.loginsight.api.ApiClient.handleNotSuccessfulResponse(ApiClient.java:616) ~[webservice-lib.jar:?]
 at com.vmware.loginsight.api.ApiClient.request(ApiClient.java:469) ~[webservice-lib.jar:?]
 at com.vmware.loginsight.api.ApiClient.request(ApiClient.java:358) ~[webservice-lib.jar:?]
 at com.vmware.loginsight.api.ApiClient.authenticatedRequest(ApiClient.java:349) ~[webservice-lib.jar:?]
 at com.vmware.loginsight.api.ApiClient.request(ApiClient.java:275) ~[webservice-lib.jar:?]
 at com.vmware.loginsight.api.ApiClient.jsonRequest(ApiClient.java:267) ~[webservice-lib.jar:?]
 at com.vmware.loginsight.web.actions.misc.ContentPackActionBean.deleteContentPack(ContentPackActionBean.java:380) [classes/:?]

<daemon host="xx.xx.xx.xx " port="16520" token="45ce8cae-8889-4e04-9dc6-07bd56401fda">
      <service-group name="workernode" />
    </daemon>
[2024-04-29 16:47:23.096+0000] ["https-openssl-apr-443-exec-17"/xx.xx.xx.xx ERROR] [com.vmware.loginsight.web.actions.misc.ContentPackActionBean] [Uninstalling content pack failed, com.vmware.vra.75]
com.vmware.loginsight.api.ApiException: Request failed. 440: Client Error (440)

contents.title: Environment
contents.text: Aria Operations for Logs 8.16.x

contents.title: Cause
contents.text:
1. When trying to uninstall a content pack an API client is created (with 60 seconds TTL session) to call the corresponding API. Before calling the Delete content pack API some preparation work is done (related to Content pack extracted fields).

2 The amount of time above preparation work takes is proportional to the number of users in Aria Operations for Logs. If this API call takes more than 60 seconds to complete, the session gets expired causing failure in uninstalling content pack.

The session is not extended before executing the API call, hence we see this indication in the logs that the API was called with expired session and it is failing.

contents.title: Resolution
contents.text:
This is a known issue and is expected to be fixed in upcoming release of Aria Operations for Logs.
 
 
Workaround:
 
You can uninstall the Content Pack using API method.
 
1. Navigate to http://<Primary_Node_IP>/rest-api
 
2. POST https://[Primary_Node_IP]:9543/api/v2/sessions
with request body:
{
    "username":"admin",
    "password": "[admin_password]",
    "provider":"Local"
}
Replace [Logs IP] and [admin_password] with correct values beforehand.
 
3. Copy the session ID value from the response.
 
4. DELETE https://[Primary_Node_IP]:9543/api/v2/content/contentpack/[content pack namespace]
Add Authorization header with following value "Bearer [session ID from previous call]"
 
Observe the status code: If it is 200 OK, then the content pack shall be removed from the system and not appear in the UI as well.

title: Help Menu and ICE expected display based on user type

contents.title: Issue/Introduction
contents.text:
In MUX, the Help and the Question Mark icon Menu, will open differently based on whether or not the user is an admin user.

The admin user must have the below permissions to be considered "admin" for the Help menu:

  • Administration - Application Setup
  • Administration – Access

What is the expected behavior for each user type regarding the Help Menu?

contents.title: Environment
contents.text: Clarity 16.2.2 +

contents.title: Resolution
contents.text:
Admin User:

  • When Admin user clicks on Question Mark button (?) they will see the Information Center.
  • To see ICE they will have to click on Help in either Information Center or Avatar - Help

 

Non Admin User:

  • When a non admin user clicks on Question Mark button (?) , they see ICE directly:
  • If they click on Avatar - Help, it loads the Broadcom technical documentation.

contents.title: Additional Information
contents.text:
Note: If you notice that the above behavior is not matching what you are seeing, and you have just started setting up Help and ICE, make sure ICE is set up correctly:

ICE / Help menu Troubleshooting

Clarity Help Icon Displayed But Not Responding or ICE does not load completely

title: Warning: "The time periods requested do not exist" moving through periods on a TSV field

contents.title: Issue/Introduction
contents.text:
Receive an alert when trying to scroll through (move to future or past periods) in a portlet grid or after changing time-scaled (TSV) view configurations within views/portlets such as

  • Home - Project - Team - Detail
  • Home - Resource - Allocations - Detail

The warning received is "Alert: The time periods requested do not exist. Review the column''s Time Scale settings". 

Is there a way to extend the date ranges for Time Slices in Clarity so this issue doesn''t happen?

contents.title: Environment
contents.text:
Release: All Supported Releases
Component: Clarity Time Slices

contents.title: Cause
contents.text:
• This is not an error message, but a warning that the information cannot be displayed due to date range constraints. 
  • The alert is given when the limit of the following availability internal time slices is reached: D_AVL, W_AVL, M_AVL.
  • There are external and internal slices that exist in Clarity. Internal slices are not exposed in the Administration > Data Administration > Time Slices page, due to potential performance issues.
  • The reason you do not see any values in the time scaled portion when you receive the warning is because the query that runs to retrieve the periods looks at the first period and last period in your number of periods and if there is not a matching value in the tables mentioned above, the query cannot run and provide any data.

contents.title: Resolution
contents.text:
1. If you are outside of the below range - please use the correct range of periods
    • The out-of-the-box internal timeslice range is as follows:
      • 28 Daily - 7 days in the past, the current day and 3 weeks in the future
      • 16 Weekly - 2 weeks in the past, the current week and 13 weeks in the future
      • 36 Monthly - 4 quarters in the past, the current quarter and 7 quarters in the future
  2. If a longer period is needed, consider switching to Modern UX where there is no limitation.
  3. Approved Internal Time Slices Extension which will add few more periods to the range. This is a pre-approved new internal timeslice range customization that can be used strictly as is (SaaS / GCP Customers please contact Broadcom support).
  4. To apply it - download the attached ZIP file and follow the instructions in the text file.
    • After applying it, the range will be set accordingly: 
      • 42 Daily - 7 days in the past, the current day and 4 weeks in the future
      • 45 Weekly - 4 weeks in the past, the current week and 40 weeks in the future
      • 51 Monthly - 4 quarters in the past, the current quarter and 12 quarters in the future

title: Microsoft SCOM Management pack not collecting Microsoft SQLServer Windows Database objects

contents.title: Issue/Introduction
contents.text:
MS SCOM MP is unable to collecting any MS SQL DBs.

The MS SCOM MP is missing the Microsoft.SQLServer.Windows.Database properties under Resource Kinds in the scom.properties file.

contents.title: Environment
contents.text:
Aria Operations 8.16.0

MS SCOM MP 9.0.0

contents.title: Resolution
contents.text:
WORKAROUND:

  • SSH to the adapter instance collector with root
  • Change directory using the command below:

    cd /usr/lib/vmware-vcops/user/plugins/inbound/msscom_adapter3/conf

  •  Edit the file scom.properties using Vi (See Editing files on an ESXi host using vi)
    • Add the following resources kind at the end of file  (as per screenshot)

      Microsoft.SQLServer.Windows.Database

 

  • Make sure that the adapter instance is collecting from the same collector where the changes were made (Note: This procedure will need to be performed on each collector which hosts the MS SCOM adapter)
    • Data Sources > Integrations > Adapter instance
  • Wait for 15 to 20 minutes and the DBs will be mapped.
  • Wait for 30 minutes to 1 hour and the metrics started to show up.

contents.title: Issue/Introduction

title: Relocation or mounting of persistent volumes fail after datastore name change

contents.title: Issue/Introduction
contents.text:
After a change of datastore name in vSphere 8.0 U2, issue can occur with PVs/FCDs unable to attach/detach. Volumes can also be stuck in released state.

In vpxd logs, we would see errors relating to created volumes stating retrieveDiskPathAssociations: :vim.fault.InvalidDatastorePath

/var/log/vmware/vpxd.log

error vpxd[2824780] [Originator@6876 sub=Default opID=0788a205-86] [VpxLRO] -- ERROR lro-262708904 -- 5202bc7b-ef27-562e-4a0c-***(5281ac6b-3989-9abc-1c94-***) -- VStorageObjectManager -- vim.vslm.vcenter.VStorageObjectManager.retrieveDiskPathAssociations: :vim.fault.InvalidDatastorePath
--> Result:
--> (vim.fault.InvalidDatastorePath) {
-->    faultCause = (vmodl.MethodFault) null,
-->    faultMessage = <unset>,
-->    datastore = <unset>,
-->    name = <unset>,
-->    datastorePath = "[<datstore-name>] <path>/<to>/<vmdk>.vmdk"
-->    msg = ""
--> }
--> Args:
-->
--> Arg diskPaths:
--> (string) [
-->    "[datastore-name] <path>/<to>/<vmdk>.vmdk"
--> ]
--> Arg datastore:
--> ''vim.Datastore:datastore-1082''
(END)

contents.title: Environment
contents.text: Version 8.0 U2

contents.title: Cause
contents.text: If a datastore name is changed, CNS database entries is not updated to reflected the change.

contents.title: Resolution
contents.text:
Please ensure valid snapshot and/or backup has been taken of VCSA before completing steps.

Workaround steps are:
1. Login to VC via SSH.


2. Stop vpxd

service-control --stop vpxd

3. Connect to postgres

psql -U postgres -d VCDB

3. Delete all volumes for the concerned datastore from DB.

delete from cns.volume_info where datastore=''<ds-url>'';

4. Reset the datastore vclock to -1 in the DB.

update cns.VPX_STORAGE_DATASTORE_INFO set vclock=-1 where datastore_url=''<ds-url>'';

5. Restart vsan-health

vmon-cli -r vsan-health.


After 1-2 minutes post restart, check the DB again and the volumes should appear in the DB with the correct diskPaths.

select * from cns.volume_info;

contents.title: Additional Information
contents.text: Engineering are aware of this issue and are working towards a fix in a future release.

title: Less than (''<'') sign not displayed for static lookup on Risk grid list

contents.title: Issue/Introduction
contents.text:
Static dependent lookups do not display less than ''<'' signs on Risk grid list although they do display on Risk detail page.
User has a requirement to use these symbols in their lookup values but when they are selected on an attribute in a grid list, the
attribute displays as a blank field.

 

Steps To Reproduce:

1. Create a static Dependent lookup called ''VV'' with id ''vv1'', Create one level and populate values with the following (without single quotes) - ''<aaaa'' , ''<xcons''
2. Create a dynamic lookup using the following query: 

    SELECT 
    @SELECT:lookup_code:ODF_PK@,                 
    @SELECT:NAME:NAME@,
    @SELECT:SORT_ORDER:SORT_ORDER@          
    FROM   cmn_lookups_v          
    WHERE  language_code=''en'' and lookup_type=''VV1'' and is_active=1 
    and 
    @FILTER@ 

3. Create a lookup attribute on Risk object using the dynamic lookup created in step two
4. In Modern UX, Open a project and on the ''Risk'' tab, create a Risk instance on the grid list page
5. Add the new attribute created in step three to the grid list.
6. Populate the lookup attribute by selecting the value ''<aaaa''

Expected:
Lookup attribute to be populated with the value ''<aaaa''

Actual:
Lookup attribute to be populated with a blank value on the grid list

contents.title: Environment
contents.text: All Clarity releases

contents.title: Resolution
contents.text: Currently under review by Engineering

contents.title: Additional Information
contents.text:
Workaround:
In the Risk detail page, the lookup value does get populated with the expected value.
